mainBoard.name: Akroan Conscriptor
mainBoard.originalText: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Akroan Conscriptor, gain control of another target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.

rulings.text: Heroic abilities will resolve before the spell that caused them to trigger.
Heroic abilities will trigger only once per spell, even if that spell targets the creature with the heroic ability multiple times.
Heroic abilities won’t trigger when a copy of a spell is created on the stack or when a spell’s targets are changed to include a creature with a heroic ability.
The ability can target any creature except Akroan Conscriptor, including one that’s untapped or one you already control.

Gaining control of a creature doesn’t cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it. Notably, if that creature is enchanted by an Aura with bestow and dies while under your control, the Aura’s controller will continue to control the creature that Aura becomes.
If you control a legendary creature and gain control of another legendary creature with the same name, you’ll choose one to remain on the battlefield and put the other into its owner’s graveyard.

mainBoard.name: Arena Athlete
mainBoard.originalText: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Arena Athlete, target creature an opponent controls can't block this turn.

rulings.text: Heroic abilities will resolve before the spell that caused them to trigger.
Heroic abilities will trigger only once per spell, even if that spell targets the creature with the heroic ability multiple times.
Heroic abilities won’t trigger when a copy of a spell is created on the stack or when a spell’s targets are changed to include a creature with a heroic ability.
Resolving Arena Athlete’s ability after a creature has blocked won’t remove the blocking creature from combat or cause the creature it blocked to become unblocked.

mainBoard.text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Arena Athlete, target creature an opponent controls can't block this turn.

mainBoard.flavorText: The Champion armed herself to face the cyclops, heedless of her companions' despair. "How will you defeat it with only one spear?" asked young Althemone. The Champion raised her weapon. "It has but one eye." —The Theriad

foreignData.flavorText: Die Auserwählte griff zur Waffe, um dem Zyklopen gegenüberzutreten, ohne auf die Unkenrufe ihrer verzweifelten Gefährten zu hören. „Wie willst du ihn denn mit nur einem Speer niederstrecken?", fragte die junge Althemone. Die Auserwählte hob ihre Waffe. „Er hat doch nur ein Auge." —Die Theriaden
foreignData.name: Zyklop vom Einaugenpass

foreignData.flavorText: La Campeona se armó para enfrentarse al cíclope, sin escuchar las plegarias desesperadas de sus compañeros. "¿Cómo vas a vencerlo con una sola lanza?", preguntó la joven Altémona. La Campeona alzó su arma. "Él solo tiene un ojo". —La Theríada
foreignData.name: Cíclopes del Desfiladero Tuerto

foreignData.flavorText: La Championne s'arma pour affronter le cyclope, ne prêtant pas attention au désespoir de ses compagnons. « Comment le vaincre avec une seule lance ? » demanda la jeune Althémone. La Championne leva son arme. « Il n'a qu'un seul œil. » —La Thériade

foreignData.flavorText: La Campionessa si armò per affrontare il ciclope, incurante della disperazione dei suoi compagni. "Come potrai sconfiggerlo con una sola lancia?" chiese la giovane Altemone. La Campionessa sollevò l'arma. "Non ha che un solo occhio." —La Theriade

foreignData.flavorText: 女勇者は同行者たちの絶望した様子も意に介さず、サイクロプスと対峙するために武器を手に取った。 「槍一本だけで、どうやって奴を倒すおつもりですか？」と、若きアルセモニーが問うた。 女勇者は武器を掲げて答えた。「あれには目が一つしかないわ。」 ――「テーリアス」

foreignData.type: クリーチャー — サイクロプス

foreignData.flavorText: 영웅은 동료의 절망에 아랑곳하지 않고 무장을 갖춰 키클롭스와 맞섰다. "창 한 자루만 가지고 이기겠다고?" 젊은 엘세모니가 물었다. 영웅이 창을 들며 말했다. "눈이 하나니까." —테리아드

foreignData.flavorText: A Campeã armou-se para enfrentar o ciclope, sem prestar atenção ao desespero de seus companheiros. "Como você o derrotará com só uma lança?", perguntou o jovem Altemone. A Campeã ergueu sua arma. "Ele só tem um olho." — A Teríada

foreignData.flavorText: Не обращая внимания на отчаяние спутников, Поборница вооружилась, готовясь сразиться с циклопом. «Но как ты победишь его с одним лишь копьем?» — спросила юная Альтемона. Поборница подняла свое оружие: «У него же один глаз». — Териада

foreignData.flavorText: 在一片绝望气氛中，天尊毅然拿起武器面对独眼巨人。 「只凭这根长矛，你怎能打败它？」年轻的阿瑟蒙妮不解。 天尊扬起手中长矛。「它也只有一只眼睛。」 ～《塞洛亚特》

mainBoard.name: Loyal Pegasus
mainBoard.originalText:
Flying
Loyal Pegasus can't attack or block alone.

rulings.text: If you control more than one Loyal Pegasus, they can attack or block together, even if no other creatures attack or block.

Although Loyal Pegasus can’t attack alone, other attacking creatures don’t have to attack the same player or planeswalker. For example, Loyal Pegasus could attack an opponent and another creature could attack a planeswalker that opponent controls. Similarly, other blocking creatures don’t have to block the same creature that Loyal Pegasus blocks.
Once Loyal Pegasus has attacked or blocked, it will remain in combat even if you no longer control another attacking or blocking creature.

If an effect says that Loyal Pegasus attacks or blocks “if able,” and you control one or more other creatures that are able to attack or block, you must attack or block with Loyal Pegasus and at least one other creature.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, Loyal Pegasus can attack or block with a creature controlled by your teammate, even if no other creatures you control are attacking or blocking.

Heroic abilities will trigger only once per spell, even if that spell targets the creature with the heroic ability multiple times.

Heroic abilities won’t trigger when a copy of a spell is created on the stack or when a spell’s targets are changed to include a creature with a heroic ability.

mainBoard.name: Ordeal of Purphoros
mainBoard.originalText:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it. Then if it has three or more +1/+1 counters on it, sacrifice Ordeal of Purphoros.
When you sacrifice Ordeal of Purphoros, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

rulings.text: The +1/+1 counter is put on the creature before blockers are declared and before combat damage is dealt.

The check of whether the enchanted creature has three or more +1/+1 counters on it happens as part of the resolution of the attack triggered ability. If the third +1/+1 counter is put on the enchanted creature any other way, you won’t sacrifice the Ordeal until the next time the creature attacks.
If you sacrifice the Ordeal in some other way, its last ability will trigger.
